articles.author: Sarah Raza
articles.title: EF5 tornado that killed 3 in North Dakota was the nation’s first in 12 years - AP News
articles.description: Meteorologists say a deadly tornado in North Dakota this summer has been upgraded to a top-of-the-scale EF5, and was the first on American soil in 12 years. The June 20 twister killed three people and at its largest was over a mile wide as it touched down for…
articles.content: A deadly tornado that tore across southeastern North Dakota this summer has been upgraded to an EF5 with winds topping 200 mph (322 kph), the strongest classification of tornado and the first on Amer… [+2635 chars]
